-- | Monad for the safe and efficient construction of continuous chunks of time values.
module Data.TimeChunkBuilder (
    -- * Chunk builder
    TimeChunkBuilder
  , buildChunk
  , TimeChunkState (..)
    -- * Resuming buildings
  , TimeChunkEnv
  , buildChunkFromEnv
    -- * Builder operations
  , insertValue
  , finishChunkBuilding
  ) where

-- control
import Control.Applicative (Applicative(..))
import Control.Monad (when)

-- vector
import Data.Vector (Vector)
import qualified Data.Vector as V
import Data.Vector.Mutable (IOVector)
import qualified Data.Vector.Mutable as MV

-- monoids
import Data.Monoid (Monoid (..))

-- transformers
import Control.Monad.IO.Class (MonadIO(..))

-- | A Time Chunk Builder environment. You can use
--   a value of this type to resume building a chunk
--   with 'buildChunkFromEnv'. The type is annotated
--   with the type of the values in the chunk.
data TimeChunkEnv e = TCE
  { chunkBuilder     :: IOVector (Maybe e)
  , initialChunkTime :: {-# UNPACK #-} !Int
  , chunkSize        :: {-# UNPACK #-} !Int
  , timeMargin       :: {-# UNPACK #-} !Int
    }

-- | Collection of values from the past and future.
data TimeChunkState e = TCS
  { valuesFromThePast   :: [(Int,e)]
  , valuesFromTheFuture :: [(Int,e)]
    }

instance Monoid (TimeChunkState e) where
  mempty  = TCS [] []
  mappend (TCS ps1 fs1) (TCS ps2 fs2) = TCS (ps1 ++ ps2) (fs1 ++ fs2)

data TimeChunkStatus e a =
    Unfinished  a                 -- ^ Unfinished intermediate value
  | Finished   (Vector (Maybe e)) -- ^ Finished chunk as an immutable vector

instance Functor (TimeChunkStatus e) where
  fmap f (Unfinished x) = Unfinished $ f x
  fmap _ (Finished   v) = Finished v

instance Applicative (TimeChunkStatus e) where
  {-# INLINE pure #-}
  pure = Unfinished
  Unfinished f <*> sx = fmap f sx
  Finished   v <*> _  = Finished v

instance Monad (TimeChunkStatus e) where
  {-# INLINE return #-}
  return = pure
  Unfinished x >>= f = f x
  Finished   v >>= _ = Finished v

-- | Time Chunk builder monad. See the builder operations below to see what you can do
--   in this 'Monad'.
newtype TimeChunkBuilder e a = TCB ((TimeChunkEnv e, TimeChunkState e) -> IO (TimeChunkState e, TimeChunkStatus e a))

instance Functor (TimeChunkBuilder e) where
  fmap f (TCB bx) = TCB $ fmap (fmap (fmap (fmap f))) bx -- did you say 'fmap'? hehe

instance Applicative (TimeChunkBuilder e) where
  {-# INLINE pure #-}
  pure x = TCB $ \(_,st) -> pure (st, pure x)
  {-# INLINE (<*>) #-}
  TCB bf <*> TCB bx = TCB $ \(env,st0) -> do
    (st1,sf) <- bf (env,st0)
    case sf of
      Finished v -> pure (st1,Finished v)
      Unfinished f -> fmap (fmap (fmap f)) $ bx (env,st1)

instance Monad (TimeChunkBuilder e) where
  {-# INLINE return #-}
  return = pure
  TCB bx >>= f = TCB $ \(env,st0) -> do
    (st1,sx) <- bx (env,st0)
    case sx of
      Finished v -> pure (st1,Finished v)
      Unfinished x -> do
        let TCB by = f x
        by (env,st1)

instance MonadIO (TimeChunkBuilder e) where
  liftIO m = TCB $ \(_,st) -> m >>= \x -> pure (st, pure x)

-- | Get the builder environment.
getEnv :: TimeChunkBuilder e (TimeChunkEnv e)
getEnv = TCB $ \(env,st) -> pure (st, pure env)

-- | Get the builder state.
getState :: TimeChunkBuilder e (TimeChunkState e)
getState = TCB $ \(_,st) -> pure (st, pure st)

-- | Set the builder state.
setState :: TimeChunkState e -> TimeChunkBuilder e ()
setState st = TCB $ \_ -> pure (st, pure ())

isBetween :: Ord a => a -> (a,a) -> Bool
isBetween x (a,b) = a <= x && x <= b

-- | Finish the chunk building.
finishChunkBuilding :: TimeChunkBuilder e ()
finishChunkBuilding = TCB $
  \(env,st) -> do
     -- We use unsafeFreeze since it is guaranteed that the
     -- chunk builder mutable vector won't be used anymore.
     v <- V.unsafeFreeze $ chunkBuilder env
     pure (st, Finished v)

-- | Insert a value in the chunk. If the value is outside of the time
--   margin (i.e. later than the chunk final time plus the time margin
--   parameter provided in 'buildChunk'), the chunk building will be
--   automatically finished.
insertValue :: Int -- ^ Time
            -> e   -- ^ Value
            -> TimeChunkBuilder e ()
insertValue t x = do
  env <- getEnv
  let t0 = initialChunkTime env
      t1 = t0 + chunkSize env - 1
  if t `isBetween` (t0,t1)
     -- Value is in the chunk
     -- We use unsafeWrite since it is guaranteed by construction that
     -- (t - t0) is a valid index in the chunk builder mutable vector.
     then liftIO $ MV.unsafeWrite (chunkBuilder env) (t - t0) $ Just x
     -- Value is not in the chunk
     else do st <- getState
             if t < t0
                -- Value is in the past
                then do liftIO $ putStrLn $ "[time-chunk-builder] Received value in the past.\n"
                                         ++ "  Value time: " ++ show t ++ "\n"
                                         ++ "  Chunk initial time: " ++ show t0 ++ "\n"
                                         ++ "  Chunk final time: " ++ show t1
                        setState $ st { valuesFromThePast = (t,x) : valuesFromThePast st }
                -- Value is in the future
                else do liftIO $ putStrLn $ "[time-chunk-builder] Received value in the future.\n"
                                         ++ "  Value time: " ++ show t ++ "\n"
                                         ++ "  Chunk initial time: " ++ show t0 ++ "\n"
                                         ++ "  Chunk final time: " ++ show t1
                        setState $ st { valuesFromTheFuture = (t,x) : valuesFromTheFuture st }
                        when (t > t1 + timeMargin env) finishChunkBuilding

-- | Resume a chunk building using a supplied environment. As in 'buildChunk', the building
--   might not finish. If this is the case, it returns 'Nothing' instead of the vector.
--   The chunk building can be continued using the same environment again.
buildChunkFromEnv :: TimeChunkEnv e
                  -> TimeChunkBuilder e ()
                  -> IO (TimeChunkState e, Maybe (Vector (Maybe e)))
buildChunkFromEnv env (TCB f) = do
  (st,sx) <- f (env,mempty)
  pure ( st -- Always return the final state
       , case sx of
           Finished v -> Just v
           _ -> Nothing
         )

-- | Build a time chunk using the 'TimeChunkBuilder' monad.
--   The chunk is returned as a vector with potentially empty
--   values ('Nothing'). If the chunk building is unfinished,
--   it returns an environment that you can use to resume the
--   chunk building using 'buildChunkFromEnv'. In addition,
--   values inserted with the chunk builder with time in the
--   future or the past are returned in a 'TimeChunkState' value.
buildChunk :: Int -- ^ Initial time
           -> Int -- ^ Chunk size
           -> Int -- ^ Time margin
           -> TimeChunkBuilder e () -- ^ Builder operations
           -> IO (TimeChunkState e, Either (TimeChunkEnv e) (Vector (Maybe e)))
buildChunk t0 s tm b = do
  v <- MV.replicate s Nothing
  let env = TCE v t0 s tm
  (st,mv) <- buildChunkFromEnv env b
  pure $ ( st -- Always return the final state
         , case mv of
             Just iv -> Right iv
             _ -> Left env
           )
